doc.field: Walter Hooke was vice president and national personnel manager of the United Parcel Service from 1965-1978 and held a variety of labor relations positions. He taught courses in human relations and labor relations later in his life. Hooke was politically active on a number of issues which are reflected in the many letters to Congress and letters to the editor included in this collection. Other documents include newspaper clippings re: Cesar Chavez's death, a transcript of an oral history interview conducted in 1986, and correspondence to Debra Bernhardt.

Walter Hooke was vice president and national personnel manager of the United Parcel Service from 1965-1978 and held a variety of labor relations positions. He taught courses in human relations and labor relations later in his life. Hooke was politically active on a number of issues which are reflected in the many letters to Congress and letters to the editor included in this collection. Other documents include newspaper clippings re: Cesar Chavez's death, a transcript of an oral history interview conducted in 1986, and correspondence to Debra Bernhardt.

Walter Hooke was vice president and national personnel manager of the United Parcel Service from 1965-1978 and held a variety of labor relations positions. He taught courses in human relations and labor relations later in his life. Hooke was politically active on a number of issues which are reflected in the many letters to Congress and letters to the editor included in this collection. Other documents include newspaper clippings re: Cesar Chavez's death, a transcript of an oral history interview conducted in 1986, and correspondence to Debra Bernhardt.
The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.023.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
